query: My wife's needs have changed significantly since her last assessment in Cambridgeshire. How do we request a reassessment and how long will it take?

retrieved_documents.content:
[Page 4]
   
 
4 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Reablement | March 2025 
 the start of your Reablement journey. This gives us the information we 
need to ensure that you are receiving the right level of care and support 
to meet your Reablement goals. 
How can you access your records?  
While you receive a service from the Reablement team you or your 
family (with your permission) can access these records. All you need to 
do is speak to any staff member who visits your home, and we can 
arrange to have these sent electronically to yourself or printed and sent 
to your home.  
 
If you are in Cambridgeshire: 
You can also call the office between the hours of 6.30 am-10pm, 7 days 
a week and this can be arranged for you.  
Reablement Duty Team – 01223 699415  
Once your Reablement period has finished these electronic notes stay 
with Cambridgeshire County Council and you can then request a copy of 
your notes through an Access Request application.

[Page 4]

do is speak to any staff member who visits your home, and we can 
arrange to have these sent electronically to yourself or printed and sent

Once your Reablement period has finished these electronic notes stay 
with Cambridgeshire County Council and you can then request a copy of 
your notes through an Access Request application.

for people through individualised care and support plans that optimise independence. 
Cambridgeshire County Council has an in-house reablement service.  The aim of the service 
is to support people to retain or regain their confidence and independence and remain 
involved in their local community. This may be after a stay in hospital, an accident or illness, 
or a change in a person’s social circumstances. 
Reablement is free to the service user and is typically offered for up to 6 weeks. Many of 
those leaving hospital are supported by the reablement teams, with 61% of their clients in 
23/24 coming via referral from hospital. In 23/24, the Reablement service supported 3,704 
people. Of these, 82% - did not go on to need a long term care package. 
Direction of Travel 
There is no plan to change our reablement offer. Cambridgeshire County Council will continue 
to support people to maximise their independence.

[Page 3]
3 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Assessment and eligibility  | July 2024  
 • how you look after yourself on a daily basis  
• your involvement in your community 
• who supports you, if anyone  
• what your needs are 
It will bring together a summary of your needs and the outcomes you 
want to achieve. The assessor will look at whether there are any risks to you and your wellbeing and agree with you how they can be best 
managed.  
 The Assessor will also look at how to help you prevent and delay the 
need for care and support. They will give you their professional opinion and following the assessment, your assessor will determine whether you 
are eligible for support from the c ouncil.   
 There may be care and support available from other organisations and 
your local community which are more appropriate to meet your needs.  
 You can buy equipment or make changes to your home and your 
lifestyle to help to keep you independent, safe,  and well.

[Page 3]

community could help with.

You can find more information about these online.

Reablement - an Easy Read guide  
 
 
Pictures  Words  
 This document is the Easy Read version of the 
‘Reablement ’ guide.  
 This leaflet tells you about the council’s Reablement  
Team and how they can help you.  
The Reablement Team can give you support for a 
short time , to help you stay independent . 
 Reablement  means helping you to do things for 
yourself again.  


[Page 2]
 
 
2 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Reablement - Easy Read | March  2025  
 Pictures  Words  
 Sometimes if you have been unwell or been in 
hospital you may need help to do the things you 
could do before.  
 Reablement  helps you get back daily living skills 
that you used to have.  
 The Reablement  Team can work with you for a short 
time until you are more confident . 
 You do  not have to pay for the Reablement  service.

records. The system we use allows the staff supporting you to have the 
information provided to us about you and your care and support needs.

answer:
To request a reassessment for your wife's changed needs in Cambridgeshire, you should contact Cambridgeshire County Council's Adult Social Care services.

- **Contact Information**: You can reach out to them via email at careinfo@cambridgeshire.gov.uk or visit their website at www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk for more details.
- **Reassessment Process**: The council will conduct an assessment to evaluate your wife's current needs, risks to her wellbeing, and determine eligibility for support. This process will also explore how to prevent and delay the need for care and support.
- **Additional Support**: There may be care and support available from other organizations and your local community, which could be more appropriate to meet her needs.

The available documents don't provide specific information about how long the reassessment process will take. For precise timelines, contacting the council directly would be advisable.

test_metadata.prompt_template:
Please answer the following question about social care services in UK local authorities based only on the information in the provided documents.

Question: {query}

Context from relevant documents:
{context}

Instructions:
1. Provide a clear, direct answer that would help someone needing this information. If information isn't available, state: "The available documents don't provide specific information about [aspect]."

2. Synthesize information from ALL relevant documents to provide the most complete answer rather than analyzing documents individually.

3. Structure your response with:
   - A concise 1-2 sentence summary first
   - Relevant details organized in short, clear paragraphs
   - Bullet points for lists or step-by-step information
   - Bold text for key information the user should notice

4. For financial information:
   - Include exact figures, time periods, and what the funding covers
   - Present financial data clearly: "The adult social care budget is **£X million** for [time period]"

5. Always include practical next steps or resources:
   - Provide contact information, URLs, or application methods mentioned in the documents
   - Suggest where the person could find more information

6. When citing sources, use a simple format: "According to [document name/description]" or include URLs where available.

Answer:
